data.enText: the way you are feeling at a particular time
She's in a good mood today (= happy and friendly) .
He's always in a bad mood (= unhappy, or angry and impatient) .
to be in a foul/filthy mood

data.chText: 一些吸毒成瘾的人一旦没有毒品就会出现情绪的激烈波动。
data.enText: Some addicts suffer violent mood swings (= changes of mood) if deprived of the drug.

data.chText: 我今晚就是没心情参加聚会。
data.enText: I'm just not in the mood for a party tonight.

data.chText: 他当时没心思以礼待客。
data.enText: He was in no mood for being polite to visitors.
a period of being angry or impatient

data.chText: 我不知道他为什么今天脾气这么坏。
data.enText: I wonder why he's in such a mood today.
She was in one of her moods (= one of her regular periods of being angry or impatient) .
the way a group of people feel about sth; the atmosphere in a place or among a group of people

data.chText: 这次会议的气氛显然很悲观。
data.enText: The mood of the meeting was distinctly pessimistic.

data.chText: 这部电影恰如其分地捕捉到了两次世界大战中间这些年的氛围。
data.enText: The movie captures the mood of the interwar years perfectly.

data.chText: 表达语气的动词屈折变化
data.enText: any of the sets of verb forms that show whether what is said or written is certain, possible, necessary, etc.
one of the categories of verb use that expresses facts, orders, questions, wishes or conditions

data.chText: 陈述 / 祈使 / 虚拟语气

word_means: 表达语气的动词屈折变化

means: 表达语气的动词屈折变化

ex.chText: 我喜欢元旦的欢乐气氛。
ex.enText: I like the cheerful atmosphere of New Year's Day.

ex.chText: 全家人都沉浸在节日的气氛之中。
ex.enText: The whole family is in a festive atmosphere.

synonyms.bx: 指周围环境或事件给人带来的感觉。

ex.chText: 她首先用一段流行音乐定下基调。
ex.enText: She first set the mood with a piece of pop music.

ex.chText: 不同的房间颜色产生不同的氛围。
ex.enText: Different room colours create different moods.

synonyms.bx: 指某一地方、事件、书、电影等呈现的基调或给人的感觉。

tr: a characteristic (habitual or relatively temporary) state of feeling
example: whether he praised or cursed me depended on his temper at the time
he was in a bad humor

tr: verb inflections that express how the action or state is conceived by the speaker

example: the national mood had changed radically since the last election

value.def: Your mood is the way you are feeling at a particular time. If you are in a good mood, you feel cheerful. If you are in a bad mood, you feel angry and impatient.

example.ex: He is clearly in a good mood today...
example.tran: 明摆着，他今天心情不错。

example.ex: When he came back, he was in a foul mood...
Lily was in one of her aggressive moods...

example.tran: 他的心情时好时坏，令人担心。

defx.def: If you say that you are in the mood for something, you mean that you want to do it or have it. If you say that you are in no mood to do something, you mean that you do not want to do it or have it.

example.ex: After a day of air and activity, you should be in the mood for a good meal...
example.tran: 你在户外活动了一天，应该很想好好吃一顿。

example.ex: He was in no mood to celebrate.

gramarinfo.label: with supp, oft adj N, oft <l>in</l> N
v-link PHR, PHR after v, oft PHR <l>for</l> n/-ing, PHR to-inf

value.def: If someone is in a mood, the way they are behaving shows that they are feeling angry and impatient.

example.ex: She was obviously in a mood.

value.def: The mood of a group of people is the way that they think and feel about an idea, event, or question at a particular time.

example.ex: The government seemed to be in tune with the popular mood...
example.tran: 政府似乎和民众的意愿是一致的。

example.ex: They largely misread the mood of the electorate.
example.tran: 他们很大程度上误读了选民的意图。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft with poss

value.def: The mood of a place is the general impression that you get of it.

example.ex: First set the mood with music...
I wanted different moods in each room.
example.tran: 我想让每个房间都感觉不一样。

value.def: In grammar, the mood of a clause is the way in which the verb forms are used to show whether the clause is, for example, a statement, a question, or an instruction.

trans: 好心情；心情不错；情绪好；良好的心情
心情愉快；愉快心情；快乐心情；愉快的心境
祈使语气；祈使式；祈使句；命令语气；命令式的
陈述语气；陈述式；直陈语气；语气；直述语气
心境稳定剂；情绪稳定剂；情感稳定剂；情绪平稳剂；情绪安定剂
